newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian copper drops, zinc gains, others steady.
newsitem.headline: Indian copper drops, zinc gains, others steady.

text.p: Copper prices dropped while zinc extended gains on the local market, but other base metals were steady in a narrow price band, dealers said on Monday.
Copper prices moved down by 50 rupees to 12,800 rupees per quintal amid sluggish industrial buying despite a firm trend in world markets. Copper was down 150 rupees per quintal last week.

Buyers kept to the sidelines, hoping the government would reduce duty in the union budget scheduled to be presented on Friday. Zinc lifted 100 rupees to 7,300 rupees per quintal in thin arrivals and shortage of ready stock but physical buying was at low ebb. Zinc rose 250 rupees per quintal last week.

Tin was steady at the reduced level of 34,100 rupees per quintal. It was down 100 rupees last week. Nickel was quiet at 37,200 rupees per quintal as was lead at 4,550 rupees and aluminium at 7,250 rupees per quintal in nominal trade.
Overall sentiments was subdued at the close amid limited physical enquiries as well as strigent monetary conditions.
